<summary>
* The invention is a new and improved safe and door structure that provides a simple and effective way to secure valuable items. The safe has a liner with a valuables receiving chamber and a door that is received in and removed from the chamber. The door is secured to the liner with a lockset and safety bolts to prevent unauthorized access.
* The safe can be formed using a variety of materials, including concrete and steel, and can be designed to be installed in a wall or floor. The door is designed to be received in and removed from the chamber with a simple and intuitive mechanism, and the lockset and safety bolts provide additional security against unauthorized access. The safe can be customized to meet specific needs and can be designed to be fire-resistant and tamper-proof.

<summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for monitoring fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, particularly in a borehole. The apparatus includes a pressure sensor arrangement comprising a filter, a pressure transducer, and a check valve, which is connected to a fluid injection tube. The fluid injection tube is connected to a larger tube at the surface, and a fluid is pumped through the system to clear the filter of cement grout and to form a void or communication path between the formation and the pressure transducer.

• The cement grout is pumped into the borehole through a grout pipe, and the fluid is pumped into the system to clear the filter of cement grout and to form a void or communication path between the formation and the pressure transducer. The fluid is pumped into the system to displace the cement grout around the filter, forming a pocket or void between the filter and the borehole wall. The filter is connected to the bottom end of the injection tube, and the pressure transducer is connected to the top of the injection tube.

• The pressure transducer is of the type where the top of the pressure sensing member is exposed to the transducer internal pressure, and the bottom of the pressure sensing member is exposed to the fluid pressure produced by the geological formation. The pressure transducer is connected to an electrical cable, which carries the electrical signals from the pressure transducer to the surface. The pressure transducer is removable and relocatable within the large tube, allowing it to be serviced or relocated to a different depth.

• The packer is inflated and sealed in the large tube by fluid pressure delivered through a tube connected to the packer inflation tubing. The packer functions as a seal to block the flow of formation liquid in the large tube, and the top of the packer inflation tubing is sealed around the electrical cable. The packer is described as an inflatable device, but it could also be a mechanically expandable packer or a seal element.

• The pressure sensor arrangement includes components that are not all located in the same area, but rather are distributed in the system. The fluid pressure produced by the geological formation enters the pressure sensing system through the formation fractures to the void zone around the filter, and the pressure of the formation fluid rises in the injection tube and exerts a corresponding force on the bottom of the pressure sensing member of the pressure transducer.

• The pressure transducer is able to accurately measure the formation pressure by sensing the pressure of the formation fluid and transmitting the pressure signals to the surface

<summary>
* The invention provides a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to the tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given the maintenance.
* The jointing structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
* The elastic members are formed by piling up a thin rubber layer and a steel sheet alternately in multiple layers to place the rubber layers under restraint so that it will be hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
* The joint block is mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap, and supporting blocks are respectively mounted to the opposite sides of the joint block with this joint block between, and the joint block and the supporting blocks are all fitted in detachable fashion so that the maintenance of the joints may be facilitated.
* The expansion gap in the joint between the traveling paths is blocked up with the joint block so that an expansion gap smaller in width than the expansion gap is provided between the joint block and each of the supporting blocks at the opposite sides thereof, and this allows the occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations in vehicles to be substantially reduced.
* The invention also provides a method of mounting an elastic member, which includes joining the elastic members together across the expansion gap and fixing the elastic member on one side to the step on one side, then subjecting the thus fixed elastic member to deformation toward the bridge girder axis, and thereafter fixing the elastic member on the other side to the step on the other side.

<summary>
* *The present invention relates to a floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks into and out of a fluid treatment chamber, such as a meat product chilling chamber, without contaminating the sanitary environment of the chamber. The system is designed to prevent the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated, allowing for recirculation and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontaminating it.*
* *The enclosed floor track system includes a wheel channel into which the wheels of the hand truck roll, and which is disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs. The wheel channel includes opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other, and has attached to it a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel.*
* *The system also includes a brine distribution piping system, a return piping system, a brine receptor, and a brine recirculation pump, which work together to shower the meat products with a chilled brine solution and cool them quickly. The floor of the fluid treatment chamber is inclined to collect the warm brine solution in a sump, where it is cooled and recirculated.*
* *The enclosed floor track system is designed to accommodate hand trucks with horizontally axled wheel structures, and includes a wheel guide that keeps the hand truck centered within the bottom of the track system. The wheel channel includes a bottom portion and upwardly extending sidewalls, with a cover plate that can be pivoted away from the wheel channel to facilitate cleaning.*
* *The system also includes an embodiment that uses inflatable seals to enclose the interior wheel channel of the track, which prevents the brine solution from entering the guide track channel and becoming contaminated. The inflatable seals are attached to the sidewalls of the wheel channel and are inflated to seal around the I-beam strut of the hand truck.*
* *The enclosed floor track system is well adapted for use in a meat product chilling chamber, and is designed to prevent the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated, allowing for recirculation and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontaminating it.*

<summary>
* The present invention provides a lock device for a work machine, which includes a lock plate, a lock pin, and guide members, and is designed to prevent the boom of the work machine from being rotated downward by its own weight.
* The lock plate is slidably supported by the guide members and has a hook part, a forward-slanted surface, and a slot, and is engaged with the lock pin to lock the boom in place.
* The lock device is designed to be operated by an operation lever, which is connected to the hook part of the lock plate, and is capable of being locked and released by rotating the boom to the foremost position or the lowest position.
* The lock device also includes a slip-prevention mechanism, which prevents the support pin from slipping out of the slot in the lock plate, and is designed to be simple and easy to assemble.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform that can be adjusted to regulate suction efficiency during cleaning.
• The device has a central, vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to enable precise regulation of suction.
• The device has a handle assembly for moving the suction head across the pool bottom and a first, or outboard, roller assembly connected to the platform.
• The outboard roller assembly has a pair of spaced apart ribs with vertically extending slots and axles that are vertically movable within the slots.
• The axles are threaded at one end and have a head at the other end, allowing for adjustment of the vertical height of the rollers.
• The device also has a second, or inboard, roller assembly connected to the platform, which has a similar construction to the outboard roller assembly.
• A frame member spans the platform and has a central portion with an aperture that receives a connector means, which is used to adjust the vertical height of the rollers.
• The connector means has a threaded shank portion and a head portion, and is used to adjust the vertical height of the rollers by tightening or loosening the wing nut.
• The device can be used with existing suction head assemblies with minimal modification, and can be adjusted to regulate suction efficiency during cleaning.
• The invention provides a simple and easy-to-use adjustment mechanism that can be manufactured inexpensively and is suitable for use with a variety of pool cleaning devices.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing, including a sub-unit for mounting onto a drill string.
* The apparatus includes a retriever section that is slidably movable along a mandrel section of the sub-unit, allowing for vertical movement while preventing rotational movement.
* The retriever section has protruding members that engage with slots in the wear bushing to retrieve it from the well, and the apparatus allows for a certain amount of vertical play to prevent damage to the wear bushing or the apparatus.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive solution for retrieving wear bushings without the need for a bit, and can be used to retrieve bushings with threaded or non-threaded collars.

<summary>
• The invention is a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage and then closes the passage by landing a plug on a seat.
• The tool has a modular design that allows the number of pistons to be selected to match the power required for the particular work string, surface equipment, or downhole conditions.
• The valve is designed to be annularly shaped, eliminating the need for a seat and allowing the wireline access feature through the passage, and the valve opening and closing occurs without slamming any part of the valve against a seat.
• The tool can be operated to deliver high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces to the stuck fish without impacts of the pistons on the housing, or with impacts on each cycle, and can be used in stimulation or fishing operations.
• The tool has a rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for torque transmission, and the design eliminates significant cyclical impacts on opening and closing due to the cylindrical shape of the valve and the seal ring.

<summary>
• The present invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site. The retaining wall is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts: a face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece. The face panel has a front face and a rear surface, and the counterfort extends perpendicularly from the rear surface of the face panel. The base piece is generally a rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform that is set on grade.
• The connection between the face panel and the base piece is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar from the face panel into an opening in the base piece and then sealing the connection with grout. The rebar is anchored to the base piece using a forged foot or a horizontal disk. The connection is designed to resist the pullout of the rebar and to provide a shear cone in the base to resist the pullout of the rebar. The retaining wall can be used in a variety of applications, including retaining soil, sand, pebbles, or rocks.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production therefrom. The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional down hole heaters: the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of design elements that protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack. The present invention provides an improved down hole heating system that focuses heat in the production zone and contains heat to promote flow to the production tubing.
• The system includes a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods. The heating unit is designed to overcome the problem of unit invasion by down hole fluids, which causes physical damage and/or electrical shortages. The system also includes a terminal portion of the heater rods encased in a cement block and a steel fitting assembly to prevent electrical problems.
• The present invention also includes a method for use of the system, which includes the use of a down hole heating unit with suitably shielded electrical connections and installation of heat-retaining elements to properly focus heat on the producing formation. The method can also be used by substituting cable for the down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit while pipe is pulled from the well bore. This approach can be particularly beneficial in treating deep gas wells with an iron sulfide occlusion problem.

<summary>

* *The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and retrieving objects in a well bore, particularly a downhole tool or a fish, and provides a simple and efficient way to connect and disconnect the tool from the object.* The mechanism includes an outer body structure, an inner body structure, and a collet or spear that can be selectively engaged and disengaged to connect and disconnect the tool from the object.
* *The mechanism includes a latching mechanism that allows the tool to be latched and unlatched from the object without the need for jarring or mechanical vibration.* The latching mechanism includes a guide pin that moves within a recess to engage and disengage the collet or spear with the object.
* *The mechanism also includes a compression spring that maintains the inner body structure in an upward position relative to the outer body structure.* The compression spring is compressed when the inner body structure is moved downwardly relative to the outer body structure.
* *The mechanism can be used for a variety of downhole service operations, including installation and removal of downhole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools.* The mechanism can be used in conjunction with a wire line controlled pulling tool to retrieve objects from the well bore.
* *The mechanism includes a collet or spear that can be selectively engaged and disengaged to connect and disconnect the tool from the object.* The collet or spear is adapted to engage and disengage the object in a controlled manner.
* *The mechanism includes a latching control element that is used to control the movement of the guide pin and the collet or spear.* The latching control element is adjustably locked relative to the inner body structure.
* *The mechanism can be used in a variety of well bore environments, including those with high temperatures and pressures.* The mechanism is designed to withstand the harsh conditions found in well bores.
* *The mechanism is simple and efficient to use, and can be used in a variety of applications, including oil and gas production and drilling operations.* The mechanism is designed to provide a reliable and effective way to install and retrieve objects in a well bore.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors, which aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate. The method involves providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, and assembling them together with glue and multidirectional holding means.
• The multidirectional holding means include dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, as well as adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane. This design helps to prevent displacement or change of dimensions between the two substrates.
• The invention also provides for a composed stave floor with a longer lifespan and the ability to undergo corrective maintenance, which can be achieved by using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, and by applying a glaze from the supplier.

<summary>
* *The invention relates to a ladder attachment that improves the lateral stability of the ladder, prevents it from slipping or sliding, and allows it to straddle corners without losing stability. The attachment includes a flange with openings for a U-bolt, which secures the ladder rung and provides a broad surface area that does not damage the work surface.*
* *The attachment also includes a resilient pad assembly that pivots on the arm, allowing it to adjust to different work surfaces and providing a non-slip gripping portion that grips the work surface without damaging it. The pad assembly can pivot horizontally or vertically, depending on the design.*
* *The attachment is designed to be adjustable and can be used on different types of ladders, including aluminum and fiberglass ladders. The U-bolt can be torqued to secure the attachment in place, and the clamp can be adjusted to fit different sizes of ladders.*
* *The invention provides a solution to the problems of ladder instability, damage to work surfaces, and difficulty reaching corners, and is suitable for use in a variety of applications, including painting, cleaning, and maintenance work.*

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a fastener assembly for use in a fastener driving tool, which includes a row of fasteners arranged substantially parallel to each other, and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners. The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles a shank of each fastener and a connecting portion that extends between and connects adjacent collar portions. The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, an epoxy, or the like, and is formulated to enhance adhesion to the fasteners and to the substrate. The collation system is designed to reduce debris generation and to improve the holding power of the fasteners in the substrate.
• The collation system includes a bridge and a rib that extend between and connect adjacent collar portions, and a notch that provides a location for separation of the connecting portion from the strip. The bridge and rib are formed having a cruciform shape, and the rib has a concave shape as it extends between the fasteners. The collation system is designed to provide a uniform material that is molded over the fasteners and between the fasteners, and to provide a shape or configuration that allows for easy separation of the connecting portion from the strip. The collation system is also designed to provide a high level of adhesion to the fasteners and to the substrate, and to reduce the amount of debris generated during use.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle has a bell-shaped tip and an injection button that provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function.
• The nozzle has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape, a hollow round and threaded section, and a bell-shaped section with an annular flanged section. The bell-shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts and provides a connection element.
• The nozzle can be coupled to most cartridges or machines containing sealant, and the protruding ring acts as a stopper in the insertion or threading of the cartridge. The sealant then enters the nozzle through the threaded hollow section and is expelled out of the nozzle through the bell-shaped section.
• The injection button has a circular main body with a peripheral groove and a hollow central circular protrusion with multiple series of radially oriented channels ending in orifices. The button can be fitted to or removed from the bell-shaped section at the user's will.
• The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, which is important for the pressurization and lifetime of aircraft, ships, trains, or automobiles. The nozzle can be used to apply sealants manually or by an extrusion or manual gun.
• The nozzle simplifies the sealing work in both aesthetic appearance and speed of execution, reducing the sealant application time, saving time and labor, and providing a more economical sealing process and increased quality of the resulting sealant application.

<summary>

* The invention relates to a position sensor that can sense the position of an object and provide a conditioned sensing signal to a remote monitoring system. The sensor uses a waveform generator to modify the unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and an error correction generator to eliminate unwanted signals. The error correction generator uses a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor to determine the value of the conditioned sensing signal and generate an error correction signal. The sensor can be calibrated to provide a minimum current draw and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor uses a window comparator to compare the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value and generate a correction signal to adjust the output. The window comparator uses a voltage divider network to set the high and low ends of the window. The sensor can be calibrated to provide a minimum current draw and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor uses a counter and a digital-to-analog converter (DAC) to generate a correction signal. The counter counts up and down based on the value of the conditioned sensing signal and the DAC generates a voltage output based on the count. The sensor can be calibrated to provide a minimum current draw and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor uses a preset to generate a pulse that causes the counter to go to its highest value and the DAC output to go to its highest value. This causes the output of the differential amplifier to go low and the sensor to draw a minimum current. The sensor can be calibrated to provide a minimum current draw and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor uses a resistor to convert the voltage output of the differential amplifier to a current drawn through the sensor leads. This allows the sensor to modulate a current across the pair of wires connected to the monitoring system. The sensor can be calibrated to provide a minimum current draw and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor uses a comparator to compare the voltage output of the differential amplifier to a reference voltage. The comparator generates a high output when the voltage output is above the reference voltage and a low output when the voltage output is below the reference voltage. The sensor can be calibrated to provide a minimum current draw and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
* The sensor uses a controller to generate a clock signal that controls the count rate of the counter.

<summary>
* The present invention is a valve actuation system for an internal combustion engine that eliminates the use of springs and provides a substantially infinitely variable actuation system.
* The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device that converts the rotary motion of a camshaft into a linear motion, which in turn actuates a valve.
* The valve actuation system is controlled by a circular drive disk that can be rotated to adjust the valve displacement, allowing for variable valve timing and lift.
* The system includes a control block that captures an adjustment pin and maintains its parallelism with the line of action of the slide assembly, ensuring precise control over the valve displacement.
* The valve actuation system is designed to operate in conjunction with a four-cycle internal combustion engine, with the valve opening and closing sequences controlled by the camshaft.
* The system can be used to control multiple valves, with two valve assemblies in a common housing shown in FIG. 7.
* The control function of the valve actuation system is demonstrated in FIGS. 8A-8D, which show the adjustment of the valve displacement and the maintenance of the required displacement during the reciprocating motion of the slide assembly.
* The system provides a simple, robust, and precise means of controlling the valve actuation in an internal combustion engine, allowing for improved engine performance and fuel efficiency.

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, which includes a light member with a housing, a lighting control region, and one or more light-emitting modules. The light member is designed to provide adjustable color temperature output and adjustable intensity.
• The light member includes a switch that allows the user to control the color temperature output, with options for white light, blue light, and a blended color temperature. The switch can also be used to adjust the intensity of the light.
• The light member can be used with a variety of aquariums, including those with different shapes and sizes. The light member can also be used with other types of enclosures and structures, such as underneath office or kitchen cabinets.
• The light member includes a timer that allows the user to set a time limit for the light to be on or off, and can be programmed to gradually ramp power up or down to create a dimming effect. The timer can also be set to a demo or preview mode to allow the user to test the settings.
• The light member can be mounted to a bracket that is attached to a cabinet, and can be connected to other light members in series to provide a longer length of lighting. The light member can also include an optics member that can be adjusted to change the angle of the emitted light.
• The invention provides a flexible and adjustable lighting system that can be used in a variety of applications, including aquariums and other types of enclosures and structures. The system allows for adjustable color temperature output and intensity, and can be programmed to provide a variety of different lighting effects.

<summary>
* *The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine, which operates at high temperatures. The apparatus is designed to avoid the disadvantages of the known apparatus, such as high blade weight, complex casting, and thermal stresses.*
* *The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls, which are used to bound the cooling channels, as separate inserts that are inserted into the apparatus and secured. This allows for a simpler and more efficient cooling system.*
* *The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be bent into various shapes, such as a U-shape, to deflect the cooling fluid. The inserts can also be secured to the apparatus using methods such as soldering or welding.*
* *The invention is particularly advantageous for rotor blades that rotate at high speeds, as it reduces the blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses, and allows for easier adjustment of the cooling system by replacing the inserts.*</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that controls the throttle valve.
• The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control, preventing the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling when control is shifted from automatic to manual. The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, which connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired.
• The system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, and can be programmed to detect the transmission ratio and switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle valve. The system also includes a logic sequencer and phase drivers for controlling a stepper motor, and a simplified control unit using discrete components and an analog converter for driving a DC motor.

<summary>
• The invention is a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate matter and operates efficiently, making it suitable for use in various industries such as boiler heat, lime kilns, plywood veneer dryers, particle board dryers, and lumber dry kilns. The burner uses a unique combination of preheated underfire air, swirl air, and secondary combustion air to achieve efficient combustion and minimize particulate emissions.
• The burner's primary combustion chamber is designed to gasify the waste fuel, producing volatile gases that are then burned in a secondary combustion chamber with additional air. The secondary combustion air is introduced tangentially and swirls around the flame holder, which forces particulate matter to the outer wall and prevents it from entering the secondary chamber.
• The burner's control system is designed to adjust the air and fuel flow rates in response to changes in BTU demand, and includes features such as temperature and oxygen level monitoring to ensure optimal combustion and minimize emissions. The system also includes manual override controls for manual adjustment of the trim controls.

<summary>
* *The invention is an evaporative cooler that uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding moisture to the air stream. The heat exchanger has a dry side and a wet side, with the dry side being cooled by fresh air and the wet side being cooled by the evaporation of water.
* *The working air used for the wet side of the heat exchanger is drawn from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, allowing for a larger temperature differential and more efficient cooling.
* *The cooled air is then circulated through the room, and a portion of the return air is recirculated back to the heat exchanger to mix with the fresh air, increasing the cooling rate. Additionally, a portion of the cooled air can be bypassed to mix with the return air, allowing for a lower temperature but at a higher energy cost.
* *The invention also includes a hybrid system that combines the evaporative cooler with a vapor compression refrigeration unit, allowing for further cooling and dehumidification of the air stream. The evaporator coil of the refrigeration unit is located in the dry side compartment of the heat exchanger, and only a minor portion of the cooled air is passed through the coil to dehumidify it.

<summary>
* The fluid pump of the present invention comprises two or more pump heads arranged in series, with each pump head having a housing, an impeller, and a drive shaft. The pump heads are connected to each other so that fluid being pumped from a reservoir passes through each pump head in sequence.
* The pump heads are designed to pump fluid at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures, with the first pump head drawing fluid from the reservoir and the last pump head discharging the fluid into a desired location. The pump heads are also designed to be modular, allowing for easy maintenance and repair.
* The pump heads are connected by a drive train that is longitudinally aligned with the longitudinal axis of the pump, with the drive train passing through the fluid flow path between the pump heads. The drive train is designed to be secure and protected from corrosion and befouling.
* The pump assembly may be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, which permits operation of the pump at a fluid reservoir. The pump assembly may also be equipped with an agitator nozzle to encourage mixing of the fluid in the reservoir.
* The pump heads may be designed with different configurations, such as three pump heads in series, with each pump head having a different design and function. The pump heads may also be designed with different materials and components to suit different applications and environments.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an engine compression release brake system that includes a sufficient, but reduced, number of components. The system includes an engine housing that defines a plurality of engine cylinders, and an engine compression release brake is provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, which is less than all of the engine cylinders. The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• The engine compression release brake includes a hydraulic actuator that is controlled by an electronic control module, which determines when to activate the brake based on the engine's operating conditions. The brake is activated by energizing a solenoid, which opens a high pressure seat and allows high pressure fluid to flow into an actuation fluid passage. The high pressure fluid then actuates a piston, which moves an exhaust valve actuator to open the exhaust valve and vent the compressed air in the cylinder.

<summary>

• The present invention relates to support structures, particularly a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox. The mounting link is designed to withstand a variety of loads, including routine vibrational loads, sudden or extreme shocks, and blade-off events. The mounting link is constructed to rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox.

• The mounting link includes a female link, a male link, and a pin that selectively prevents the relative translation of the female link and the male link. The pin is designed to shear when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied, allowing the female link and the male link to translate relative to each other.

• The female link and the male link are in contact at a radial interface, which provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation. The amount of coulomb damping provided by the radial interface is determined by the coefficient of friction, the geometry, and the contact areas of the female link and the male link.

• The mounting link is designed to limit or prevent damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals by transmitting extreme loads, while simultaneously preventing the gearbox from detaching from the engine. The mounting link is also designed to prevent the gearbox from detaching from the engine during extreme loads.

• The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly, the unfused mount components, and the engine mounting structure. The pin is formed of a less durable material than the female link and the male link to facilitate the desired shear characteristics.

• The mounting link is designed to provide a fusible link that can shear when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied. The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly, the unfused mount components, and the engine mounting structure.

• The mounting link is designed to provide a snap ring to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link. The snap ring is installed after the male link is disposed within the female link to retain the male link at the end of the travel range.

• The use of the pin and the coulomb damping provided by the radial interface obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving the extreme loads produced during fan blade-off events. The pin can be replaced with an intact pin during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break the pin.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an end adaptor apparatus and balance pin apparatus for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts, which solves the problems of stress on the shaft, dirt entering the shaft, and difficulty in balancing the arrow. The invention provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight, and a balance pin that can be trimmed to obtain the exact point weight for perfect balance.
</summary>

<summary>

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator designed for use with small arms training. It is a cost-effective means of simulating small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation. The SAFES unit is designed to resemble a magazine clip and is inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. It produces sound and flash by electrically igniting pyrotechnic charges in a confined space and venting the combustion products through the weapon's ejection port.

• The SAFES unit consists of ten functional blocks, including a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, 500 Hertz oscillator, 10 Hertz oscillator, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, and MILES interface. The bolt interface provides a realistic simulation of operator actions during the firing of live rounds. The trigger interface utilizes a resistor, capacitor, and Schmitt trigger to debounce the trigger signal.

• The oscillator control circuit uses a D flip-flop, NAND gate, and inverter to control the output of the 500 Hertz oscillator. The 500 Hertz oscillator is enabled when the bolt actuation signal is present and is inhibited when the firing sensor signal is present. The 10 Hertz oscillator is used to provide a timing pulse to the firing counter and firing decoder.

• The firing counter and firing decoder are used to decode the firing sequence and provide a signal to the firing control circuit. The firing control circuit uses thirty-one SCR's to control the firing of the pyrotechnic charges. The firing sensor provides a signal to the oscillator control circuit and MILES interface when a charge fires.

• The SAFES unit is designed to be reusable and is packaged in a reusable housing that resembles a magazine clip. The housing contains the electric control circuitry, plastic expendable, and pyrotechnic charges. The plastic expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process and contains thirty cups with pyrotechnic charges and bridge wire.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that aims to improve engine performance by utilizing the dynamic effect of air flow while reducing noise from the air intake. The device includes a tank, a first pipe with a larger cross-sectional area, and a second pipe with a smaller cross-sectional area, which are connected to the intake passage and a control valve that is actuated by an actuator in response to engine operating conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket that allows for simple mounting of equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure.
• The bracket consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be connected and adjusted to mount the equipment at a desired angle.
• The adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and secured to the stationary bracket using integrated hooks and tabs, allowing for easy installation and adjustment.
• The bracket can be used to mount a variety of equipment, including speakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, and video cameras, and can be secured to a pole or wall using a chain and hooks.
• The invention provides a convenient and efficient way to mount equipment, allowing for easy installation and adjustment without the need for additional parts or tools.

<summary>
• The present disclosure relates to a burner for a heat utilizing appliance, which includes a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, and a shroud providing a second wall surrounding the outer wall to establish a flow path for tertiary combustion air.
• The burner also includes a fuel feed feature to enable renewing the fuel supply during operation, and a modular heat utilizing appliance that can be detachably coupled to the burner, which can be a cooker, a food smoker, a space heater, or a pyrolyzer.
• The pyrolyzer can condense vaporized liquid products of pyrolysis and recover liquids of different boiling points, and can also cool gaseous products of pyrolysis to a predetermined temperature for safe use or distribution.</summary>

<summary>
* *The invention aims to improve the cooling system of a rotary internal combustion engine by providing a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water jacket passageway, which allows for a more uniform and controlled flow of coolant around the bosses, reducing the risk of thermal distortion and structural failure. This arrangement also improves the heat transfer coefficient between the flow and bosses, increasing the efficiency of the cooling system.
* *The staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses is achieved by offsetting the centerlines of the bosses with respect to the centerplane of the flow, creating a controlled flow regime that prevents the formation of swirling eddies and promotes a high heat transfer coefficient. This arrangement also allows for the release of vapor generated at the hot surfaces of the bosses, reducing the risk of boiling and improving the overall performance of the engine.
* *The invention has been tested using a water model passageway and has shown a significant improvement in heat transfer coefficient, with a 44% increase in heat transfer rate compared to the traditional in-line arrangement. The invention also reduces the risk of thermal distortion and structural failure, making it a more reliable and efficient cooling system for rotary internal combustion engines.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, using control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance.
* The method uses a test compensation circuit that adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing.
* The test compensation circuit uses a "look up table" to determine the flow compensation required for a given TCV reference, and a sample and hold circuit to pass the flow compensation to a multiplier circuit.
* The use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95% compared to a control valve test without flow compensation.

<summary>

* *The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, with the outlet mixture ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid. The valve has a valve body, a first inlet passage, a second inlet passage, and an outlet passage. The valve body defines a bore and a second bore, and the first and second inlet passages are connected to the bore. The valve body also defines a threaded hole for receiving a retaining screw.
* *The valve has an elongated valve member that is received within the bore and has a cylindrical portion with a bore extending therethrough. The valve member also has a sealing sleeve that is stretched over the cylindrical portion and has a pair of perpendicularly intersecting bores. The sealing sleeve is made of a material such as TEFLON and is elastic.
* *The valve member has a cylindrical portion adjacent to one end of the cylindrical portion for receiving a seal carrier. The seal carrier has a bore sized to receive the cylindrical portion and defines a boss that contacts a surface of the cylindrical portion. The seal carrier also defines a recess for housing a nut.
* *The valve member has a series of consecutive cylindrical spools adjacent to the end of the cylindrical portion opposite the seal carrier. The spools are generally sized identically to each other and are slidably received within the bore. The valve member also has a pin that extends through the bore and is secured to the handle.
* *The valve has a handle that is connected to the valve member and has a gripping portion for manually adjusting the valve. The handle also has a bore that extends through it and a pin that extends through the bore and is secured to the valve member.
* *The valve has a flow restricting device that is connected to the first inlet passage and reduces the flow rate of fluid from the first inlet passage to the bore. The flow restricting device is a screw made of a material such as 316 S/S and has a torques-type head with a bore that extends axially from the center of the torques receptacle to the end of the screw.
* *The valve has a check ball valve or similar mechanism that can be installed within the first inlet passage to inhibit back flow of water into the soap solution source. The valve also has a check ball valve or similar mechanism that can be installed within the second inlet passage to inhibit back flow of soap solution into the water source.

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure. The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method. The compressor station includes at least one compressor, at least one heat exchanger, and control units for controlling the compressor and valves.

• The compressor station is designed to operate in two modes: summer operation and winter operation. In summer operation, the station is designed to cool the compressed gas to a temperature of at most 0°C by expanding it in an expansion turbine. In winter operation, the station is designed to operate with a lower pressure and a lower temperature, and the expansion turbine is not used.

• The compressor station includes a primary compression stage, a secondary compression stage, and an expansion stage. The primary compression stage includes two compressors that compress the gas to a pressure of about 50 bar. The secondary compression stage includes a compressor that compresses the gas to a pressure of about 75 bar.

• The expansion stage includes an expansion turbine that expands the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure. The expansion turbine is driven by the compressed gas and recovers some of the energy used in the compression process. The recovered energy is used to drive the compressor.

• The compressor station is designed to operate with a high degree of flexibility, allowing it to adjust to changes in the gas flow rate and the ambient temperature. The station includes multiple compressors and valves that can be controlled to optimize the compression process.

• The invention has several advantages over traditional compressor stations. It is more efficient, as it recovers some of the energy used in the compression process. It is also more reliable, as it has fewer moving parts and is less prone to mechanical failure.

• The invention is particularly useful for compressor stations that operate in permanent frost areas, where the ground temperature is below 0°C for most of the year. The station is designed to operate in these conditions, and it can be used to compress gas to a pressure of up to 100 bar.

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure. The system includes a motor, a fan blade, and a motor carrier with mounting legs that are designed to be seated into recessed portions on the panel. The recessed portions have openings with enlarged and residual opening regions that allow the mounting legs to be compressed and seated into place. The system also includes spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel once the mounting legs are seated, preventing vibrational noise and ensuring secure attachment.

• The cooling fan assembly is designed to be used in various applications, including the automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation industries. The assembly includes a motor that rotates a fan blade to move warm air from the interior of an enclosure to the exterior through exhaust portals. The motor is typically an electric motor, but can also be a non-electric motor, such as a hydraulic or pneumatic motor. The motor is connected to a motor carrier that includes mounting legs that are designed to be seated into recessed portions on the panel.

• The recessed portions on the panel have openings with enlarged and residual opening regions that allow the mounting legs to be compressed and seated into place. The enlarged opening region is larger than the turned-out portion of the mounting leg, allowing it to freely pass into the opening without restriction. The residual opening region is smaller than the enlarged opening region, but larger than the turned-out portion of the mounting leg, allowing the mounting leg to be seated into place. The spring members urge the motor carrier away from the panel once the mounting legs are seated, preventing vibrational noise and ensuring secure attachment.

• The installation process for the cooling fan assembly involves positioning the assembly against the panel, compressing the spring members to seat the mounting legs into the recessed portions, and rotating the assembly to secure it in place. The compressive force acts to compress the spring members and move the turned-out portions of the mounting legs into the residual opening regions. The rotating force repositions the resilient legs into the residual opening regions, capturing them in place. The spring members remain in a compressed state, urging the turned-out portions of the mounting legs against the exterior surface of the panel.

• The present invention provides a secure and efficient way to attach a cooling fan assembly to a panel without the need for fasteners. The system is designed to reduce the risk of vibrational noise and ensure secure attachment, making it suitable for use in a variety of applications. The system can be modified or adapted to suit specific

<summary>

* *Spacecraft structures require the use of advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have very little inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics, which can compromise the functionality of instruments and electronic payloads. The vibration levels can be particularly high during powered flight and pyrotechnic separation/release events. As a result, 14% of spacecraft launches through 1984 suffered vibration/shock related failures, with 50% resulting in catastrophic mission loss.*
* *Kinematic mounts are used to support instruments and electronic payloads, but they have limited success in minimizing loads transmitted to the instrument. The mounts are designed to safely carry launch loads, but they do not provide a strong and stable support system to the instrument during launch.*
* *The present invention provides kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The mounts incorporate vibration damping materials to dissipate energy and reduce the high energy disturbances to the instrument.*
* *The damping mechanism can be provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts. The most active portion of the mounts will occur at these flexural hinge locations, which can be taken advantage of by designing local dampers at these locations.*
* *The present invention includes two embodiments of the damper design: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper. The spherical damper uses a spherical damper with a viscoelastic material, while the cylindrical slot damper uses a series of o-rings or VEM washers.*
* *The cylindrical slot damper can be used to induce compression/tension into the VEM, which can be tailored to achieve the desired damping performance. The VEM washers can be used instead of o-rings, which can provide slightly different bending stiffness characteristics.*
* *The present invention also includes a series of flat washers that can be used to model and analyze the damping performance. The analysis results indicate that the six suspension modes can be damped by as much as 10% of critical modal damping.*
* *The present invention provides a simple design simplification by using a single strut design for all six bars, which can be machined monolithically from blocks of metal. The design also provides a center-of-gravity mounting system, which can be beneficial in applications where dynamic disturbances are inherent within the instrument.*
* *The present invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads, providing a significant performance improvement over the design without the damping treatment.*

<summary>
* The invention is a novel and improved clutch unit that overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions, particularly in large size power transmission requirements.
* The clutch unit has a unique design that applies strong coupling forces between the plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy in accordance with various input conditions.
* The unit also features a segmental disc arrangement that minimizes the deleterious effects of heat on the discs and allows for convenient inspections without requiring total disassembly.
* Additionally, the invention provides a new and improved clutch unit that minimizes residual drag, which is extremely important in clutch units of the capacity of the present invention.

<summary>
* *The invention provides a system for internal combustion engines that captures and recycles heat energy, allowing for a significant increase in thermal-to-mechanical efficiency. This is achieved through the use of cascaded cylinders, where the exhaust gas from one cylinder is used to power another cylinder, creating a continuous expansion motor.
* *The system also includes a water injection system, where water is injected into the cylinders to cool the engine and increase efficiency. The water is then recovered and reused, reducing the need for a radiator and minimizing water consumption.
* *The system can be further optimized by using catalytic materials to reduce emissions and improve fuel efficiency, and by using thermal insulation and low-conductive materials to minimize heat loss and maximize energy extraction.

<summary>
* The present invention provides a method for fabricating a precoated steel plate with a precoat comprising an intermetallic alloy layer and a metal alloy layer, where the metal alloy layer is removed from the periphery of the plate to prevent the introduction of the metal coating into the molten area during welding.
* The precoat is formed by dipping the steel plate in a molten bath of an aluminum alloy, and the intermetallic alloy layer is in contact with the steel substrate and has a thickness of 3-10 micrometers.
* The metal alloy layer is removed by brushing or laser beam ablation, and the width of the removed area is adjusted to ensure that the precoat is not introduced into the molten area during welding and to provide corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
* The precoated steel plate is then welded using a continuous welding process, such as laser beam welding, electric arc welding, or plasma welding, and the welded joint is then heat-treated to form a surface alloy and austenize the steel substrate.

<summary>

• The present invention is a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile energy recovery system. The system includes a central service facility, a mobile structure, and a control and communications microprocessor system. The mobile structure is designed to recover energy from severe weather patterns, such as hurricanes or storms, and can be a sailing vessel, a propelled vessel, or a buoyant energy recovery system. The control and communications microprocessor system is responsible for controlling the mobile structure's movements and energy recovery operations.

• The system uses a variety of sensors and control circuits to monitor and control the mobile structure's movements and energy recovery operations. These sensors and control circuits include accelerometers and gyroscopes to analyze the vessel's stability, ballast draft readings and adjustments, wind vane and anemometer readings, and fuel gauges for both propulsion motor fuel reserves and output fuel from energy recovery functions.

• The system also includes a GPS receiver to track the mobile structure's position, velocity, and heading, and a compass to determine the vessel's direction. The system uses weather satellite data and other sources of weather information to determine the best course of action for the mobile structure.

• The system's control algorithm uses a velocity prediction program (VPP) to predict the mobile structure's velocity and energy recovery performance, and a least-cost or highest yield path analysis to determine the best route for the mobile structure to take.

• The system's GUI (Graphical User Interface) allows human operators to monitor and control the mobile structure's movements and energy recovery operations in real-time. The GUI includes a variety of icons and data fields that allow operators to view and adjust the mobile structure's position, velocity, and heading, as well as its energy recovery performance.

• The system's GUI also includes a virtual reality representation of the mobile structure's attitude and a weather map with path analysis lines to help operators make informed decisions about the mobile structure's movements and energy recovery operations.

<summary>
* *The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, and a method for manufacturing such a rolling body guide cage.* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction.
* *The flat material ring segments are cut out from a sheet metal material and have an axial profiling formed by forming techniques.* The ring element is produced from a sheet metal material and is composed of at least three flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction.
* *The ring element is produced by forming from a combined ring element, and the weld points are indicated along which individual ring segments are welded to one another in a forming step which precedes plastic forming.* The ring element forms several rolling body guide windows which are arranged in succession in the circumferential direction and are separated from one another by guide webs.
* *The ring element can be produced as a rolling body guide cage for a groove ball bearing, an axial cylinder roller guide cage, or a ball guide cage for an axial ball bearing.* The ring element forms several rolling body guide windows which are arranged in succession in the circumferential direction and are separated from one another by guide webs.
* *The ring element can be produced with a joint contour which forms two engagement tongues which are anchored positively in a corresponding complementary contour.* The joint contour forms two engagement tongues which are anchored positively in a corresponding complementary contour.
* *The ring element can be produced with a certain degree of material accumulation which makes it possible to generate a substantially flat weld point.* The ring element can be produced with a certain degree of material accumulation which makes it possible to generate a substantially flat weld point.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates associated with the customer service location, and providing directions for a service technician traveling between multiple customer service locations.
* The invention includes a technician server that requests coordinates from a service technician at a customer service location, updates a database with the coordinates, and provides the coordinates to a mapping system to generate driving directions for the service technician.

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, which has two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object against influences of an interfering field. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
* The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors to virtual sensor signals, which are then processed by independent control loops to generate control signals for the compensation coils. The control algorithm can be linear or non-linear, and the system can be used for various applications.
* The system can also be used in a double installation, where two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, and feedback effects between the systems are taken into account by using a feedback matrix C.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering (CARS) microscopy.
• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes.
• The invention makes it possible to equip a sample that inherently does not possess, or does not possess sufficient, resonance sites, or in which the resonance sites do not exhibit the desired localization or specificity, with corresponding resonance sites.
• The bioorthogonal reaction can be a modified Huisgen cycloaddition, a nitrone dipolar cycloaddition, a norbornene cycloaddition, a (4+1) cycloaddition, or an oxanorbornadiene cycloaddition.
• The invention is particularly suitable for use in CARS microscopy, which is a method for investigating a sample by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
• The method can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.
• The invention makes it possible to introduce resonance sites into a sample in a way that does not substantially modify the structure of the sample.
• The invention can be used to increase the sensitivity and specificity of CARS microscopy.
• The invention can be used to generate a stable, reproducible background signal in CARS microscopy.

<summary>

• The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as electronic files, for use in radiation therapy. The system receives two or more electronic files providing segmentations for the same structure, and identifies common, missing, and extra volume elements between the segmentations. The system then compares the segmentations using a measurement metric, which can be customized by the user.

• The system provides an interface screen for identifying and loading the segmentation files, and allows the user to select the structures to be compared. The system also provides an option to select the cross-sectional plane for the comparison.

• The system voxelizes the segmentations, converting them into a 3D voxel model, and adjusts the voxel models for any origin offsets. The system then compares the voxel models, characterizing each voxel as common, missing, or extra, and determining the scalar distances between the voxels.

• The system provides an analysis window for displaying the segmentations, with common volumes shaded green, missing volumes shaded blue, and extra volumes shaded red. The images of the shaded volumes can be superimposed over an image of the actual structure.

• The system provides a quantitative evaluation of the comparison of the two segmentations, including primary and secondary volumes, missing and extra volumes, and a metric method/metric score. The system also provides a histogram table tallying the voxels of the missing and extra volumes according to a distance measurement bin.

• The system can be used in the training of clinicians on general contouring and target delineation, and for periodic quality assurance testing of anatomy auto-segmentation routines and systems.

• The system provides a formula parameter table for customizing the measurement metric, allowing the user to enter their own formulas and name them with a text string.

• The system provides a graph for plotting the metric method, allowing the user to visualize the relationship between the metric method and the distance measurement.

• The system provides an option to print a report, which includes the quantitative evaluation and histogram table.

• The system is designed to be user-friendly, with an intuitive interface and customizable options for the measurement metric and report output.

<summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for accelerating the execution of floating point operations, particularly the effective subtraction operation. The effective subtraction operation is a complex process that requires aligning fractions and normalizing the result. The invention aims to reduce the time required to execute this operation.

• The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument. This subset difference is used to begin the subtraction of differences between operand fractions before the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is determined.

• The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures: one for when the absolute value of the difference between the exponent arguments is greater than one, and another for when the absolute value is less than or equal to one.

• When the absolute value of the difference is greater than one, the invention performs the subtraction operation to ensure a positive result, eliminating the need for a separate step to negate the result.

• When the absolute value of the difference is less than or equal to one, the invention performs the subtraction operation without the need for alignment of fractions, reducing the number of steps required.

• The invention also calculates a difference between the seven least significant bit signals of the operand exponent argument, which is used to determine the correct final fraction result.

• The invention uses a detection and logic unit to determine the correct final fraction result based on the difference between the subset of signal positions and the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.

• The invention uses a shift and selection logic unit to select the correct procedure for calculating the final fraction result based on the difference between the seven least significant bit signals.

• The invention accelerates the computation of the final fraction result by initiating the calculation of the final fraction result before the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is determined, reducing the overall time required to execute the effective subtraction operation.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method and system for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, which includes storing a patient's information, order barcode number, and patient barcode number in a database data structure. The method also includes inputting the patient's barcode number, order barcode number, blood drawer's barcode number, and vial barcode number into the computer, and storing these barcode numbers in a relational manner in the database data structure. The system includes a computer, a computer storage, and a barcode reading means, and the method is performed by the computer and the barcode reading means. The method is used to track the specimen and ensure that it is collected and processed correctly.
• The method and system also include steps for determining whether the patient's barcode number and order barcode number are related to the same patient, and for storing the blood drawer's barcode number and vial barcode number in a relational manner with the patient's barcode number and order barcode number. The method and system also include steps for outputting a signal to the blood drawer to draw the blood sample and send it to a lab for analysis, and for storing the specimen collection time in the database data structure. The method and system are designed to reduce the risk of mislabeling of specimen vials and to improve the accuracy of the specimen tracking process.

• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide golfers with distance and other information about the golf course, and can be incorporated into an article of clothing or headgear. The device can also be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be expanded to include features such as data uploading and downloading, and expert system advice.
