<summary>
* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, i.e., logic and memory. The system and method eliminate false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool. The system and method also eliminate the need for manual checking and the possibility of false errors. The invention is particularly useful in the semiconductor industry and similar industries where different design rules must be applied to different types of regions on a substrate.
* The system and method include a standard logic design rule and customized logic rules for different types of areas, such as specialized memory areas. The customized logic rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory-based parameters onto a stricter logic-based parameter. The system and method also include a design rule checker that checks a design in GDS form against the standard logic design rule and customized logic rules. The design rule checker reports any errors detected in the design.
* The system and method also include a system that derives customized memory rules from standard logic design rules. The system identifies different types of memory and applies different design rules to each type of memory. The system also identifies intermediate regions between logic and memory areas and applies logic rules to these regions. The system and method eliminate the need for manual checking and the possibility of false errors.
* The system and method are particularly useful in the semiconductor industry and similar industries where different design rules must be applied to different types of regions on a substrate. The system and method are also useful in industries such as liquid crystal display manufacturing and similar micro-patterned technologies. The system and method can be implemented using a conventional computer system and software routines and libraries. The system and method are not limited to any particular embodiment and can be modified and extended to suit different applications and industries.

<summary>

• The invention is a waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator that provides controlled illumination of objects, including holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs). The WGH illuminator uses a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, to achieve high diffraction efficiency.

• The WGH illuminator occupies a much smaller volume than conventional lens systems, making it more compact and rugged. The active volume of the WGH illuminator is proportional to the thickness of the waveguide substrate.

• The diffraction efficiency of the WGH illuminator is high, approaching 0.99, and can be further improved by careful design. The undiffracted light is trapped in the waveguide, reducing stray light and increasing efficiency.

• The WGH illuminator has some limitations, including the need for precise alignment of the laser beam and the potential for nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront. The nonuniformity can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam or by recording the hologram nonuniformly.

• The WGH illuminator can produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side of the waveguide, which can be used for display holograms but may not be suitable for illuminator holograms. The unutilized beam can reduce the useful efficiency and introduce noise into the system.

• The WGH illuminator can be used to illuminate SLMs, allowing for modulation of the polarization or phase of the light. This can be used to create selective constructive and destructive interference between the directly emitted beam and the reflected beam.

• The WGH illuminator can be recorded using two different configurations, one using a cubic glass prism and the other using a prism coupler. The holograms were recorded on silver halide plates and bleached.

• The quality of the reconstructed beams was analyzed, including polarization and phase characteristics. A slight nonuniform depolarization was observed, which is still under investigation.

• The WGH illuminator has the potential to be used in a variety of applications, including display holograms, SLMs, and other optical systems. The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described and can be modified and improved by those of ordinary skill in the art.

<summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, particularly squirrel cage rotors for induction motors. The test apparatus includes a test head and a retraction and drive mechanism to rotate the rotor. The test head has a core with primary windings and a voltage pick-up coil to sense the induced voltage in the rotor. The retraction and drive mechanism is powered by a hydraulic cylinder and a drive motor.

• The test head also includes a skew pick-up coil to sense the effective skew of the rotor. The skew pick-up coil is positioned in quadrature with the primary windings and at the end of the core. The test head is designed to test the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.

• The test apparatus includes a data acquisition and processing system to acquire and process the test data. The system includes an analog-to-digital converter, a sample and hold circuit, and a data processor. The data processor calculates the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor from the test data.

• The test apparatus also includes a control processor to control the test sequence and process the test data. The control processor receives input from the data processor and generates output signals to the test head and retraction and drive mechanism. The control processor also controls the display and printing of the test results.

• The test apparatus is designed to test the rotor in a non-destructive manner, with the rotor being rotated at a rate of one revolution in four seconds. The test apparatus is also designed to be efficient, with the ability to test two rotors simultaneously.

• The test apparatus includes a unique clutch mechanism to securely hold the rotor in place during rotation. The clutch mechanism includes annular sleeves and o-rings that compress and extend to hold the rotor in place.

• The test apparatus also includes a position sensor to detect when the rotor is in the retracted position, at which point the drive motor is activated to rotate the rotor. The position sensor is connected to the control processor, which generates the drive signal to the drive motor.

• The test apparatus is designed to provide accurate and reliable test results, with the ability to detect defects in the rotor and provide a pass/fail determination. The test apparatus also provides statistical information on the test results, including averages and standard deviations.

<summary>
* *The present disclosure provides a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library. The managed library is effectuated by intermediate language instructions and metadata, and the digital certificate is used to determine what privileges the managed library has.*
* *The method also includes denying access to native resources of the operating system to a managed application that includes a digital certificate authorizing the managed application to access a specific native resource of the operating system through the managed library. The managed application is stored in a digitally signed container, and the digital signature is checked to determine that the managed application has not been tampered with.*
* *The method further includes verifying a digital signature associated with a container that includes the managed application, and loading the managed application in response to user input. The managed application is associated with a certificate that identifies it as un-trusted, and the certificate lists one or more managed libraries that the un-trusted application can call.*</summary>

* *The invention relates to an improved identification card containing an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.* The card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage and provide a low-cost, easily constructed identification card. The card is particularly useful for applications where the card is subject to bending stresses.
* *The card has a core layer comprising a silica-filled polyolefin, which is pre-shrunk to prevent shrinking during printing of artwork or attachment of electronic components.* The core layer is then printed with fixed indicia and an alkyd resin spid containing an anti-binding agent. The spid is printed in a racetrack design and is used to secure the antenna and IC chip.
* *The antenna and IC chip are attached to the core layer using a silver-epoxy adhesive.* The antenna is printed onto the spid in a matching pattern, and the IC chip is attached to the antenna using solder bumps. The core layer is then bonded to a bottom sheet using a first adhesive layer.
* *The bottom sheet is also pre-shrunk and printed with artwork.* The bottom sheet is then bonded to the core layer using a second adhesive layer, which is cut into recesses to accommodate the IC chip. The core layer and bottom sheet are then encased in a laminate of silica-filled polyolefin.
* *The laminate is then laminated using a nip-roll lamination process.* The top laminate material is a 7/3 TXP (5)/KRTY layer, and the bottom laminate is a 7/3 TXP (5)/KRTY layer. The resulting card is then imprinted with personal information on both the front and back.
* *The card can also be personalized using an inkjet receiver coating.* The receiver coating is patch-coated onto selective areas of the core layer opposite the bottom layer. Image and text are then printed onto the receiving layer using a Canon 8200 printer and pigment-based inks.
* *The printed cores are then belt laminated on both sides using 7/3 TXP (0)/KRTY as both the top and bottom laminate.* The resulting card is a durable and easily constructed identification card that protects the electronic components and provides a low-cost, easily constructed identification card.
* *The invention provides significant improvements in durability and ease of manufacture as compared with the prior art identification cards and smart cards.* The

<summary>
* The invention relates to a memory that implements a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) queue using a tree-shaped data structure. The tree is balanced, meaning that all leaf nodes are at the same level, and all internal nodes are full except for those on the edges of the tree. The tree is also filled upwards, meaning that a non-full leaf node on the edge of the tree is filled first, and if that is not possible, a non-full internal node on the edge is filled.
* The memory structure can be implemented with a header node that contains pointers to the beginning and end of the queue, as well as a tree representing the middle part of the queue. The header node can be inverted, allowing the queue to be used as a double-ended queue. The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by copying the header node and updating the inversion bit.
* The memory structure can also be implemented without a header node, in which case the inversion bit can be added to the individual nodes to indicate which edge of the tree is the beginning or end of the queue. The memory structure can be used to implement a deque, which is a double-ended queue that allows additions to be made to the beginning and deletions to be made from the end.
* The memory structure can be implemented in a block diagram, which includes an actual memory, intermediate registers, and control logic. The control logic maintains the queue by adding records to the leaf node of the end of the queue and deleting records from the leaf node of the beginning of the queue. The memory structure can be used to implement a FIFO queue, a LIFO queue, or a deque.

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies, which can be used to support programmable redundancy circuits on DRAM devices. This method utilizes the same manufacture procedures as the DRAM manufacturing procedures, allowing for the creation of EPROM devices and DRAM devices on the same wafer without adding additional manufacturing cost.
• The EPROM devices of the present invention have several advantages, including the ability to be manufactured using existing IC technologies, the ability to store large amounts of data at low cost, and the ability to be used in security applications due to the undetectable nature of the stored data. Additionally, the devices can be used in a variety of applications, including programmable redundancy circuits on DRAM devices.
• The SEPROM devices of the present invention use the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data, and can be used in a variety of applications, including security applications due to the undetectable nature of the stored data. The devices can be manufactured using any IC technology, and can store large amounts of data at low cost.

<summary>
* The invention is a method of determining feedback gain for a control system, particularly for an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) running along a predetermined course. The method involves executing feedback control using a provisional gain value, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and adjusting the gain value to obtain a suitable evaluation value. The evaluation value is used to evaluate the stability, accuracy, and response of the control system.
* The method is applied to the running control of an AGV, which runs along a running course with different sections having different running conditions. The AGV is equipped with a lateral deviation detector that detects the deviation of the AGV from the course, and a central processor that executes the feedback control and gain determination process. The running course is divided into four sections, and the gain determination process is executed for each section.
* The gain determination process involves increasing the gain value in steps and calculating the evaluation value at each step. The evaluation value is used to determine the optimum gain value, which is the value that provides the best stability, accuracy, and response of the control system. The optimum gain value is determined by function interpolation or by setting a fixed range for the evaluation value.
* The method can be applied to various control systems, including those with different types of feedback gains, such as proportional (P), integral (I), and differential (D) gains. The method can also be used to determine the optimum gain values for different running conditions, such as different speeds or different types of terrain.

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio, while minimizing the physical size of the lens system.
* The zoom lens consists of five lens units, including a first lens unit of positive power for focusing, a second lens unit of negative power for varying the image magnification, a third lens unit of negative power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth lens unit of positive power for making the diverging light beam almost parallel, and a fifth lens unit of positive, negative, positive, negative, and positive powers for forming the image.
* The lens units are designed to satisfy specific conditions to achieve good correction of aberrations and minimize the size of the lens system.
* The conditions include inequalities for the refractive power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit.
* The lens system is designed to have a total length of 8.109 to 8.1461 times the diagonal of the effective picture frame, which is shorter than the conventional zoom lenses.
* The lens system has a focal length of 1-5.56 and a F-number of 1:1.6-2.4, with a zoom ratio of 1:1.6-2.4 and an angle of view of 47.6°-9.0°.
* The lens system is designed to have a high relative aperture, with a maximum relative aperture of 1.6-2.4.
* The lens system is suitable for use in photographic cameras and video cameras.
* The invention provides a compact and lightweight zoom lens with high optical performance, making it suitable for use in various applications.
* The invention achieves a great advance in reduction of the size of the zoom lens, with a total length of 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A, which is shorter than the conventional zoom lenses.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like, in a detector, which generates a charge pulse when a particle passes through it.
* The method and device enable both the detection of individual particles and the integration of a plurality of particles, without knowing in advance the signal rates to be expected.
* The detection of individual particles is performed in a first, fast amplifier, while the integration of particles is performed in a second, slow amplifier.
* The signals are separated as a function of the rate by a capacitor preceding the first amplifier, or a high-pass filter, and/or by an inductive element preceding the second amplifier, or a low-pass filter.
* The device includes a detector, a first amplifier, a second amplifier, and an evaluation unit, and is suitable for detecting particles in particle accelerators, reactors, diagnostic devices, and medical technology applications.
* The invention also provides for the detection of uncharged particles by doping or coating the detector material with a converter material.
* The device is designed to operate at high beam rates, and includes a support capacitor to rapidly compensate for discharging of the detector.
* The invention enables the detection of elementary particles without knowing in advance the signal rates to be expected, and is suitable for a wide range of applications, including scientific examinations, medical technology, and electrical power engineering.

<summary>

• The invention is an automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies, which are used in friction clutches to connect a source of rotational power to a driven mechanism. The apparatus includes a test enclosure, a pair of rings, a support plate, and a transfer bar that moves the support plate and rings relative to each other.

• The apparatus also includes a torque motor that exerts a predetermined amount of torque on the driven disc assembly, and an optical encoder that measures the rotation of the driven disc assembly. The apparatus uses a microprocessor to control the operation of the torque motor and the servo motor that moves the support plate and rings.

• The microprocessor reads the signals from the optical encoder and the position sensor to determine the distance between the rings and the amount of warpage in the driven disc assembly. The microprocessor then compares these values to predetermined standards to determine if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances.

• If the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances, the microprocessor actuates the servo motor to move the support plate and rings to the starting position, allowing the operator to remove the driven disc assembly and install another one for testing. If the driven disc assembly is not within specified tolerances, the microprocessor actuates the servo motor to halt further movement of the support plate and rings.

• The apparatus also includes a display that generates a visible alert to the operator if the driven disc assembly is not within specified tolerances. The microprocessor can also store the measurements taken during the testing process for statistical process control.

• The apparatus is designed to be automated, allowing the operator to simply install the driven disc assembly and start the testing process. The apparatus can also be programmed to respond to different control switches and signals.

• The invention provides an improved method for testing driven disc assemblies, allowing for faster and more accurate testing. The apparatus can also be used to test other types of components that require precise measurement and control.

• The invention is useful in a variety of industries, including the automotive and aerospace industries, where precision and accuracy are critical. The apparatus can be used to test a wide range of components, from small gears to large bearings.

Here is the summary in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method and system for estimating the age of a person from an image of their face.
* The method includes extracting feature vectors from the image using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm.
* The CAM algorithm is a statistical model of appearance that combines a modified active shape model (MASM) and a quasi-localized texture model.
* The MASM represents the facial structure, while the texture model represents the pattern of contourlet-based intensities across a facial image patch.
* The feature vectors are then used to train a support vector machine (SVM) to distinguish between youth and adult faces.
* The SVM is trained using a Gaussian kernel and a regularization parameter C.
* The trained SVM is then used to classify a new image as either a youth or an adult.
* If the image is classified as a youth, a growth and development mapping function is used to estimate the age.
* If the image is classified as an adult, an adult aging mapping function is used to estimate the age.
* The estimated age is provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, along with an optional confidence factor indicating the correlation between the estimated age and the feature vector.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, with the aim of preserving the definition of the image with the higher definition. The device includes a controller that produces display light intensity signals for each pixel, and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels. The arrangements can be formed by a square of four pixels, with three pixels dedicated to the display of the first image and one pixel dedicated to the display of the second image. The controller can apply light intensity signals to the pixels of the arrangement to form the merged image.
* The device can be used to display a first image produced by a night vision sensor or an infrared sensor, merged with a second image produced by an infrared sensor, an echography sensor, or a monochrome or two-color symbology image. The first image can be displayed in monochrome, with a definition of 2000x2000 pixels, while the second image can have a lower definition, such as 400x250 pixels. The device can be implemented using a microdisplay of OLED type with active matrix and white emitters, with a red colored filter associated with the pixels intended for the display of the second image.
* The controller can apply light intensity signals to the pixels of the arrangement to form the merged image, with the signals being determined by the intensity of the light emitted by the pixels of the first image. The controller can also apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals to reduce the intensity of the light emitted by the pixels of the first image. The attenuation function can be a linear or non-linear relationship between the intensity of the light emitted by the pixels of the first image and the intensity of the light emitted by the pixels of the second image.

The device can be implemented using a matrix display device with a controller, a video interface with the night vision sensor, a video interface with the microcontroller or microcomputer, and an output interface with the matrix of pixels.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which has a housing with electronics and a communication means that can be brought into communication with a communication means of the security system on board the motor vehicle.
* The identification transmitter has a payment element that can be removed from the housing and brought into data communication with an electronic payment system, allowing for cashless payment transactions.
* The payment element can be integrated into a carrier that is removably fastened in the receptacle of the housing, and the carrier can have its own communication means for communication with the payment system.
* The identification transmitter also has a closure that can be moved between an active and passive position, and in the passive position, the payment element is protected and sealed off from the external environment.

* The disclosed embodiments relate to an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use. The device is often put into a "sleep mode" to save energy, and when it "wakes up", the device starts warming up and performs imaging operations with toner. The tribo charge of the toner is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, and a toner concentration sensor measures the concentration of the toner in the developer. The sensor level is used to adjust the supply of toner to increase the concentration of the toner when it is low.
* The inactivity determining section determines the inactivity of the machine, and the predicting section predicts the next user usage based on the user's usage pattern. The calculating section calculates the decay of the tribo charge of the toner based on the difference between any two sensor levels. The updating section updates the information on the user usage pattern, predicted next user usage, sensor levels, and decay. The storing section stores the information for future use.
* The disclosed methods for charging the developer include determining the inactivity of the machine, measuring the sensor level of the TC sensor, calculating the decay of the tribo charge of the toner, and charging the toner based on the calculated decay. The methods also include performing a marking operation after charging the toner. The toner may be charged by multiplying a constant and the difference between the sensor levels, and the toner may be charged again to ensure that it has a tribo charge for normal operation.

The invention aims to provide a rotary magnetic head type apparatus permitting independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure. <summary>
• The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improving the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The prior art uses a passive technique employing a gradiometer or an active technique using a transmitter and receiver to induce and sense magnetic fields associated with the currents in the objects.
• The model MAC-51B Magnetic and Cable Locator is a known apparatus that uses a transmitter to induce alternating currents in non-ferrous metal pipes, power cables, or communication cables, and a receiver to sense magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• When a second object is present adjacent to the first, the output signal characteristic of the receiver becomes distorted, making it difficult to trace the desired object.
• The invention uses a transmitter with a pair of antennae that are spaced a few feet apart and driven by RF signals to generate corresponding magnetic fields that induce distinguishable currents in the objects.
• The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects, and the receiver is moved back and forth across the objects to produce an output signal characteristic that has two distinct nulls over the respective objects.
• The invention can produce two distinct output signal nulls over the respective objects, allowing for easier and more accurate location and tracing of the objects.
• The invention is especially useful in an environment where the horizontal separation between the objects is related to the depth of the object to be located and traced.
• The invention can be modified to use different techniques to make the currents in the respective objects distinguishable, such as using different carrier frequencies, amplitude-modulated frequencies, or pulsed repetition rates.

• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The apparatus includes a source of power, a selective switch for connecting the speaker phone to the telephone network, and a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection.
• The apparatus also includes a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker phone to receive incoming telephone calls on the speaker phone when the selector switch is actuated.
• The invention provides a simplified, portable, and readily connectable automatic answering service for automatically interconnecting incoming telephone calls with a speaker phone to permit two-way communication by the recipient with a minimum amount of circuitry and with a simple connection.

• The present invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications and provides a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy to those amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals. The system includes an optical fiber cable trunk configured in a ring topology with one or more telecommunications hubs serially interconnected therein. The hubs are access points to the optical fiber cable trunk and route communications signals onto or from the cable trunk. The system also includes branching units that allow for convenient add/drop points for telecommunications traffic from the cable trunk. The branching units are optically coupled to the optical fiber cable trunk and to branch fiber optic cables that connect to cable stations.

• The system utilizes the branch fiber optic cables to transmit and receive optical communications signals and to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength to remotely located optical amplifiers. The optical energy is used to amplify the attenuated telecommunications signals. The system also includes light emitting power sources that produce energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength and are coupled to the branch fiber optic cables. The light emitting power sources are used to remotely pump the optical amplifiers.

• The optical amplifiers are used to amplify the attenuated telecommunications signals and are located in the branch fiber optic cables or in the optical fiber cable trunk. The optical amplifiers are erbium doped fiber amplifiers that convert the energy delivered from the light emitting power sources into amplified telecommunications signals. The amplified signals are then transmitted along the optical fiber cable trunk.

• The system provides several advantages, including the ability to maintain full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations in the event of a single trunk cut, and the ability to isolate a single branch cut without compromising the ring integrity. The system also allows for reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units and reduces the number of undersea repeaters required.

• The system is particularly well suited for undersea applications, but can also be used in terrestrial communications systems. The system is designed to be scalable and can be used in a variety of different configurations.

• The system is described in detail in the following sections, including a block diagram of the preferred embodiment, a description of the components and their functions, and a discussion of the advantages and limitations of the system. The system is illustrated in several figures, including a block diagram of the repeaterless trunk and branch fiber optic ring network, a block diagram of a branch assembly, and a block diagram

* The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices, which provides a finished look without exposed fasteners. The device consists of two parts: an attachment plate and a cover plate. The attachment plate is attached to the wiring device using screws, and the cover plate is then attached to the attachment plate using latching pawls and saw-tooth shaped racks. This allows the cover plate to be easily installed and removed without visible fasteners.
* The cover plate device is designed to accommodate various types of wiring devices, including switches, receptacles, and combination devices. The attachment plate has apertures that match the shape of the wiring device, and the cover plate has a corresponding aperture to accommodate the wiring device. The device can be used with one, two, three, or four ganged boxes, and the attachment plate and cover plate are designed to accommodate the corresponding number of wiring devices. The device is suitable for use in residential, commercial, and public buildings.
* The invention provides several advantages over prior art cover plate devices, including ease of installation and removal, a finished look without exposed fasteners, and the ability to accommodate various types of wiring devices. The device is also designed to accommodate irregularities in the wall, such as unevenness or curvature, by using saw-tooth shaped racks and latching pawls. The device is suitable for use in a variety of applications, including residential, commercial, and public buildings, and is particularly useful in areas where aesthetics are important, such as in high-end residential or commercial buildings.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which is intended for use with television sets, monitors, and other devices.
* The known shielding device has several disadvantages, including the need for a special fastening device and a bulky design that can be irritating and affect the outward appearance of the housing.
* The invention provides an improved extendable shielding device that consists of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner.
* The strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and can slide over one another between a pushed-in position and a pushed-out position.
* The light-shielding device can be folded around the displaying screen to take up relatively little space, and can be easily fitted to a screen using Velcro or other attachment methods.
* The strips can be designed with a decreasing wall thickness, viewed in the axial direction, to allow for the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen.
* The invention also provides an adapter member that provides a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device, allowing it to be attached to a variety of monitors with different shapes and sizes.

<summary>
* *The present invention relates to automated speech technologies that provide an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can understand. The invention aims to improve comprehension by detecting a speaker's rate of speech, comparing it to a listening rate, and warning the speaker to slow down when the speaking rate exceeds the listening rate.*
* *The invention includes a device that can monitor the rate of speech during a discourse and provide an indicator to the speaker when the rate is too rapid for listener comprehension. The device can be a wearable device, a teleprompter, or a networked device that uses speech processing components to determine the speaking rate and language proficiency of the listener.*

• The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which allows for a higher picture sequence frequency with simple means and flexibility. The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane.
• The device uses a cyclic line counter that carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses, where N/p is an integer greater than 1. The end-of-count pulse is applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression.
• The device also includes a sawtooth generator synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam. The sawtooth generator and the beam suppression circuit are controlled via a delay device, which is triggered by the output of the counter.
• The line counter is a programmable counter, and the value p can be regulated at a control desk. The device can be used to record IR, UV, or X-ray pictures, and the video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for purposes of analysis.
• The device allows for a picture sequence frequency that is increased by approximately a factor of 40 compared to a conventional TV half-frame, while the spatial resolution of the picture has suffered only in the vertical direction. The resolution in the line direction is of high quality.
• The device can be used to record processes that were previously recorded using very expensive film cameras with rotating mirrors, which were not suited for an immediate analysis by a computer. The device provides a flexible and cost-effective solution for recording and analyzing rapid processes.

• The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a technique for handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services. The invention allows existing customer premises equipment and network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. A blended call is a call that supports voice and multimedia exchanges of information. The invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and accesses a database to determine if the intended recipient of the phone call has blended capabilities.

• The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and existing network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. The invention is well suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) configuration as the information included in the SIP messages contains the information helpful in setting up and tearing down the parallel call components. The invention may be used on any number of network systems using a number of different protocols. The invention is not limited to a specific type of network or protocol.

• The invention includes a communication network, a telephony server, a multimedia server, and a blender. The communication network may include a packet switched network with SIP enabled devices. The telephony server and the multimedia server may be connected to the communication network and may communicate with each other and other components in the communication network via SIP. The blender may be software that embodies the functionality of the invention.

• The invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and accesses a database to determine if the intended recipient of the phone call has blended capabilities. If the answer is negative, the call is handled according to conventional protocols. If the answer is affirmative, the intended recipient supports blended calling, and the call is referred to the blender. The blender initiates two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.

• The invention also includes a methodology for an incoming multimedia call. The client desires to instant message the client and sends an IM to the client with the computer type device. The multimedia server receives the multimedia request and references a database to determine which multimedia server serves the destination address of the IM request. The multimedia server sends an invitation to the client via the blender.

• The invention also includes a methodology for an outgoing voice call from a client. The client dials a number with the telephone type device, and the telephony server receives the dialed number. The destination address is extracted by the telephony server to determine that the client is actually making a call rather than activating a call handling feature. The call can be a speed call activation, a normally dialed number, or other technique

<summary>
* The present invention is related to a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices to perform contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies.
* The framework has a central reference point, such as a server, and each communicating device synchronizes to the content determined by this central reference point.
* The central reference point is preferably hosted by a server and may also host content.
* The client device shares contextual information or dynamic attributes with the central reference point via a synchronization request.
* The central reference point verifies the request and uses the contextual information to compile a bundle of files for the requesting client.
* The bundle is preferably compressed to save bandwidth and time over low-bandwidth connections.
* The client device creates a delta list of files to retrieve and downloads the files in the order indicated by the central reference point.
* The client device replaces any local copies of the files with the new retrieved files and confirms complete download of the bundles.
* The present systems and methods are highly scalable and deployable worldwide with support for multiple languages and character sets from a central reference point and distributed content servers.

* *The invention is a foil electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages.* The foils are arranged collinearly and are separated by a dielectric material to maintain the vacuum. The foils are thin enough to require a supporting grid for structural integrity, and the grid is attached to the foil holder. The foil electron multiplier is designed to maximize the electron transmission and minimize the ion feedback.
* *The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.* The gain is defined as the ratio of the output current to the input current, and it is shown to increase as the applied voltage is increased. The maximum gain is achieved at an applied voltage of approximately 650 V per stage. The gain per stage is higher than that of a microchannel plate detector.
* *The foil electron multiplier uses secondary electrons emitted from the rear surface of a foil to generate a cascade of electrons.* The secondary electrons are accelerated by the voltage applied to each foil and are transmitted to the next foil in the series. The electrons continue to multiply as they traverse the foils, resulting in a growing avalanche of electrons. The avalanche is collected on an anode, which can be connected to sensing electronics to measure the output charge or current.
* *The foil electron multiplier is designed to minimize ion feedback.* Ions generated at the input surface of a particular stage are accelerated toward the previous stage, but cannot penetrate the foil. This minimizes the ion-induced avalanches and reduces the noise in the output signal.
* *The foil electron multiplier is constructed using a series of foil stages and a conductive anode.* The foil stages are aligned in an evacuated chamber, and the anode is connected to an ammeter to measure the output current. The foil stages are separated by a dielectric material, and the spacing between adjacent foil stages is 5 mm.
* *The foil electron multiplier is used to amplify a 2.7-mm-diameter 50 keV O+ ion beam.* The input end of the multiplier is biased to a negative bias of 650 V, and the output current is measured as a function of the applied voltage. The multiplier gain is shown to increase as the applied voltage is increased.
* *The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain per stage than a microchannel plate detector.* The gain per stage is higher due to the use of secondary electrons emitted from the rear surface of the foil. This results in fewer required stages in a foil

* *The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows ordinary 2-dimensional motion pictures to be viewed in part as a 3-dimensional experience.* It achieves this by taking advantage of the Pulfrich effect, which creates a 3-dimensional illusion through lateral motion of an ordinary motion picture.
* *The system consists of viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital photo sensor, and a computer processor.* The processor processes the digital images and identifies synchronization events to control the state of the lenses and produce the desired video effect.
* *The lenses of the viewing glasses can take three different states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear.* These states are synchronized to the foreground lateral motion of the motion picture to create the 3-dimensional effect.
* *The system works equally well with any type of viewing media, including TV, film, DVD, computer monitor, and liquid crystal display.* It also allows older motion pictures to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect.
* *The battery-powered viewer glasses are controlled in real-time by an intelligent processor packaged with the glasses.* This allows the 3-dimensional effect to work equally well whether the movie is viewed on a TV, DVD player, PC, or in a movie house.
* *The system reduces eyestrain and discomfort by only activating the darkening of the lenses when sustained lateral motion is detected.* This makes it possible to view 3-dimensional motion pictures for extended periods without discomfort.
* *The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes the problems of providing 3-dimensional illusions in motion pictures by eliminating the need for special equipment for filming and projection.* It also eliminates the need for special glasses or headgear.
* *The system is designed to be lightweight and portable, making it easy to use and transport.* It is also designed to be easy to use, with a simple and intuitive interface.
* *The 3-D Phenomenoscope has many potential applications, including entertainment, education, and therapy.* It has the potential to revolutionize the way we experience motion pictures and other forms of media.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw. The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die. The apparatus includes a pad for supporting the wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply the mechanical pressure to the wafer. The pressure mechanism can apply pressure in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion to cause the wafer to break along the trenches.
• The trenches are formed by applying a photo resist layer to the wafer, patterning the layer to form openings over the scribe lines, and etching the wafer to form trenches along the scribe lines. The photo resist layer is then removed, and the wafer can be back-grinded to reduce its thickness. The trenches are formed to a depth that is a desired percentage of the overall thickness of the wafer, and the etch can be performed using a plasma etch or a wet etch. The trenches can also be formed on the bottom or non-active surface of the wafer.
• The wafer is then placed on a soft pad with the active surface facing down, and mechanical pressure is applied to the back surface of the wafer to cause it to break along the trenches. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion, and the wafer can be singulated into individual die. The individual die can then be handled and packaged separately. The present invention provides a faster and more efficient method for dicing semiconductor wafers than traditional wafer saws, and it can be used with wafers of any size or type of die.

* *The present invention is directed to a field emission display device that includes a structure for deflecting the discharge path of gas ions away from a cathode, preventing surges in electrical current and burnout damage to field emission elements.* The device includes a cathode, an anode, and an operating voltage source, as well as a protection structure that includes at least one reduction plate or electrode.
* *The reduction plate or electrode is provided on the cathode and is electrically connected to a bias voltage source that applies a negative voltage to the plate.* This attracts positive nitrogen and oxygen ions away from the cathode, preventing them from inducing surges in electrical current.
* *The protection structure can be formed in various shapes, including elongated and parallel, meshwork-shaped, or net-shaped configurations.* The reduction plates or electrodes can be fabricated on the cathode plate at the same time as the cathode strips.
* *The field emission display device can be manufactured using various techniques, including photolithography and etching.* The reduction plates or electrodes can be formed on the top of the cathode plate and separated from the cathode strips by an insulation layer.
* *The present invention provides a novel protection structure for preventing burnout damage to field emission elements in a field emission display device.* The structure can be used in various types of field emission display devices, including those with elongated and parallel, meshwork-shaped, or net-shaped configurations.

* The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes, which can be used to image a plurality of planes simultaneously. The image sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges, one of which has a surface receptive to light.
* The image sensor includes an image sensor element formed in the substrate and located adjacent the one edge, which includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region in which charge carriers are generated by light impinging on the surface of the one edge.
* The image sensor also includes means in the substrate for guiding charge carriers in the image sensing region toward the charge collection and transfer means. This is achieved through the use of P+ layers, which create a barrier to electron movement and guide the charge carriers back toward the middle of the substrate.
* The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, including the top surface and the edges of the sensor. This allows for the simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
* The image sensor can be formed using processing techniques that are compatible with those used in forming other types of image sensors, making it easy to incorporate into various types of known image sensors.
* The image sensor can be used in various applications, including color applications where a red filter is placed over the image sensor elements in one imaging plane, a green filter covers the elements in a second imaging plane, and a blue filter covers the elements in a third imaging plane.
* The image sensor can also be used to image a color document in a single pass of the sensor, making it a useful tool for various applications where high-speed imaging is required.

<summary>

• The invention relates to a home network with devices that incorporate power management systems, where a network master node performs network administrative functions and a network slave node performs its nominal device functions. The network master node can enter a power management state, and the network slave node can be promoted to become the new network master node. This allows for energy conservation and ensures that the network is not lost when the network master node enters a power management state.

• The home network includes a plurality of devices, such as a video server, an audio server, a video system, and an audio system, which are communicatively coupled to each other via a network medium. Each device has a master/slave device-network-interface (DNI), a device manager, and a power manager.

• The network master node performs network administrative functions, such as beacon transmission, device association and authentication, admission control, and bandwidth assignment and communication with other network master nodes. The network master node also manages all traffic on the network.

• When the network master node receives an instruction to enter a power management state, it sends data enabling the network administrative functions to be performed to a network slave node. The network master node then enters a power management state, and the network slave node becomes the new network master node.

• The network slave node can be selected based on its visibility on the network, its intelligence/functional capabilities, or a combination of both. The network master node can also select a network slave node that has been specifically selected by a user to become the new network master node.

• The network administrative functions are transferred to the network slave node while the slave node is performing its own nominal device functions. The network administrative functions can also be transferred intermittently with the network slave node's performance of its own nominal device functions.

• A network slave node can receive a request to transfer a network administrative function from a network master node and send a request reply to the network master node, indicating that it will accept the transfer of the network administrative functions.

• The network slave node can also self-promote itself to the network master node role if the current network master node is unplugged or becomes unavailable.

• The invention provides a means for transferring the network administrative functions from a network master node to a network slave node, allowing for energy conservation and ensuring that the network is not lost when the network master node enters a power management state.

• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. The directional properties of antennae and the processing of phase and amplitude information from separate antenna elements have long been used for determining the angle of arrival of signals, and thus determining the direction of the source transmitter. However, low elevation angles are difficult to measure because of interference from strong unquantifiable reflections from the ground.

• The prior art of UK 1449196 is illustrated in FIG. 1, which shows a single equi-spaced triplet for which the two R.F. outputs A+C and B are shown to be functions of the elevation angle θ of incidence upon the array of a radio wave arriving from a remote source and of the ground reflection coefficient p.

• The invention extends the ideas of UK 1449196 to optimize angle measurements, using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles. The invention uses at least four antennae spaced so as to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, each triplet characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the centre element above the ground plane.

• The invention uses radio receiver means to obtain from each antenna of each triplet an information signal of which both amplitude and phase relative to the amplitude and phase of information signals obtained from other antennae of each triplet are functions of the elevation angles θ of incidence upon the array of a radio wave arriving from a remote source and of the ground reflection coefficient p.

• The invention uses first logic means associated with each triplet to combine vectorially the information signals obtained from the outermost antennae of that triplet to provide a first derived signal of which the amplitude represents the modulus of such combination.

• The invention uses second logic means associated with each triplet to derive from an information signal obtained from the centre antenna of each triplet a second derived signal of which the amplitude represents the modulus of that information signal from the said centre antenna.

• The invention uses dividing means associated with each triplet to divide one derived signal by the other to provide a quotient signal for each triplet which is a function of θ but not of p.

• The invention uses selection means to provide at least one quotient signal which provides a measure of the elevation angle.

• The array may operate in a receive mode, in which case unambiguous angle measurement is provided by the signal processing circuits embodied in the antennae receivers, or in a transmit mode, in which case the transmitted signal from each antenna in the array must be coded so that it

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamp, subminiature lamp, lamp assembly, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal. The invention aims to provide a solution that will provide a much longer bulb life by combating the mechanisms of bulb degradation. The solution involves a polymeric seal support that directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope.

• The polymeric seal support is made of a non-thermally conducting material that can withstand significant subminiature lamp temperature. The material is chosen based on the maximum working temperature of the elastomer, which is 200°C for fluorocarbon and 232°C for silicone. The material is also chemically non-reactive and can be selected to include additives for specific objectives.

• The polymeric seal support forms a static radial seal with the straight sidewall of the subminiature lamp glass envelope surface. The seal length is much longer than conventional "o" ring type seals, which typically have a seal length of around 0.027 inches. The stretch level of the polymeric seal support is calculated to be around 3%.

• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for adhesive or cement, which can create uneven application and off-center conditions. The seal supported subminiature lamp assembly has only one surface required to make a seal, which reduces the number of sealing points and minimizes the risk of seal failure.

• The polymeric seal support is designed to withstand the operating temperature of the subminiature lamp, which is 75% less than the area near the filament. The seal is also designed to withstand the compression forces used to insert the subminiature lamp into the instrument.

• The polymeric seal support is fabricated with close tolerances and is used in conjunction with an abbreviated height one piece conductive base. The abbreviated height one piece conductive base has a hub outer diameter that is about 0.005 inches larger than the mating section of the internal bore of the polymeric seal support.

• The abbreviated height one piece conductive base is partially coated with an instant adhesive capable of bonding elastomers to metal. The area is separated significantly from the high temperature portion of the glass envelope adjacent the filament.

• The polymeric seal support and abbreviated height one piece conductive base are assembled by inserting the abbreviated height one piece conductive base into the bottom end of the polymeric seal support. A potting material is then injected into the space within

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a technique for realizing a GDFE Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems, which significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss. The technique is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including presently planned future "4G" cellular networks.
• The GDFE Precoder includes an interference pre-cancellation block denoted by I-G, where G has the structure of a Block Upper Right Triangular matrix. The triangular structure of the feedback matrix G helps to ensure that the symbol vector encoded at the kth step will suffer from the interference from (k-1) symbol vectors only.
• The input covariance matrix Sxx for the downlink channel is defined as Sxx = E[xxH] and satisfies the transmit power constraint, i.e., trace(Sxx) ≤ Pt, where Pt denotes the total available transmit power. The input covariance matrix for the downlink channel represents dependencies of symbols transmitted from different ones of the N transmit antennas.
• The transmit filter B is used to process the symbol vector x obtained after the DFE stage of the GDFE Precoder, and is denoted by the following equation: B = VΣ1/2M, where M is a unitary matrix and the matrices {V,Σ} are same as defined in (1).
• The feedforward filter F is expressed as F = GMH, where G is the interference pre-cancellation matrix and M is a unitary matrix. The matrix C is computed using the expression C = (HVΣ1/2)H[HHSxxH+SSzz]−1, where SSzz is the "Least Favorable Noise" covariance matrix.
• The GDFE Precoder can be computed using different methods, including one that assumes the knowledge of Szz and another that provides ways to compute GDFE matrices without any knowledge of Szz.

* *The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors according to the situation, without using an intermediate electrode. The panel consists of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer. The first and second luminescent layers are made of different materials that emit light with different colors. The panel can display green light at a low voltage and lemon light at a high voltage.
* *The first luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light including no visible red light components, and the second luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light including visible red light components. The second luminescent layer is partly overlapped with the first luminescent layer, forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion. The single layer portion emits green light at a low voltage, and the double layer portion emits lemon light at a high voltage. The panel can be used as an instrument panel for an automobile, displaying green light at night and lemon light during the day.
* *The threshold voltage of the single layer portion is determined by the layer thickness and material properties of the first luminescent layer, and the threshold voltage of the double layer portion is determined by the layer thickness and material properties of both the first and second luminescent layers. The difference between the threshold voltages is positive, and the luminance of the panel increases as the driving voltage increases. The panel can be driven at a low voltage to display green light and at a high voltage to display lemon light.
* *The color purity of the panel can be changed by changing the width of the second luminescent layer or the thickness of the second luminescent layer. The color purity can also be changed by changing the driving voltage. The panel can display a range of colors, including green, yellow, and lemon, by adjusting the driving voltage and the width of the second luminescent layer.
* *The manufacturing process of the panel includes forming a uniform ITO layer on the glass substrate, etching the ITO layer into stripes, and forming the first and second insulation layers and the first and second luminescent layers on the ITO layer. The second electrodes are formed on the second insulation layer, and the panel is completed by etching the second electrodes into stripes. The panel can be modified in various ways,

• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal for internet/network telephony, which uses a network and/or the internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal comprises audio means for reproducing sound on the basis of a first electrical signal and recording sound resulting in a second electrical signal, converting means for converting the second electrical signal into transmission data, and protocol means for handling and controlling communication of the received and transmission data in accordance with a standardized internet/network protocol. The terminal also comprises wireless communications means for wireless near-field communication of the received and/or transmission data in a wireless data format with a connecting unit adapted to establish a connection to a network and/or the internet.
• The system according to the invention comprises a service server connected to the internet and/or a network, which comprises one or more databases where relevant information concerning the users of the system is saved. The server can keep track of which terminals/users are accessible and where, and can establish a connection between users who have wanted contact. The system also provides additional services, functions, etc., such as news, reading of mails, speech mails, commercials, music, stock exchange and financial news, etc., which may be sent to a user of the system, e.g. depending on a user profile.

<summary>
• The invention provides a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, which includes growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate, and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer. The buffer layer is preferably a germanium layer, which reduces the reactivity at the surface and enhances the epitaxy of the deposited oxide.
• The invention also provides a structure that includes a semiconductor substrate, a germanium layer, a non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer, and a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer, which can be used in various semiconductor structures such as capacitors, MOS transistors, and pixels for light detecting arrays. The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer can be a ferroelectric oxide, and the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer can be a ferroelectric oxide or a titanate.

<summary>

* *The existing receiver input circuits have a problem of achieving a favorable compromise between small and large signal behavior, low production cost, and limited dynamic characteristics of passive and active semiconductor components.* The known circuits use amplification control to prevent overloading of the circuit, but this control can cause non-linearity and signal distortions.
* *The invention provides a receiver input circuit with a control loop for amplification control, where the control signal is derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage.* The control signal is used to control the amplification of the circuit, avoiding overloading and signal distortions.
* *The invention also provides a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage, with a response threshold and frequency band width lower than the first control circuit.* This second control circuit helps to avoid overloading of the mixer stage and frequency influences acting on the oscillator.
* *The invention further provides a third amplification control loop whose response threshold and frequency band width are lower than the first and second control circuits.* This third control circuit helps to support the other control circuits and provides additional protection against signal overloading.
* *The invention also provides an embodiment of the input circuit with a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation, which has the advantage of protecting the input circuit against signal overloading and high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna.* The PIN diode also has the advantage of providing a constant operating current during amplification control.
* *The invention also provides an embodiment of the tunable network with a separate supply and adjustment of the tuning voltage for the varactor diodes, which permits an iteration-free alignment of all tunable tuning circuits of the receiver input circuit.* This embodiment provides a high degree of identity of the C (U) characteristic of the varactor diodes, making separate adjustment of the tuning voltage unnecessary.
* *The invention also provides an embodiment of the tunable network with a single twin diode forming the resonant circuit, which has the advantage of providing a high degree of identity of the C (U) characteristic of the varactor diodes.* This embodiment also provides a high degree of selectivity and a high degree of amplification of the receiver input section.

<summary>

* *The invention relates to a system and method for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between two or more parties to a telephone call, without complex and time-consuming setup processes.* The system includes a telephone and a PC, both connected to a LAN, and a collaboration control program that runs on the PC. The program communicates with the phone to control the collaborate indicator and sense actuation of the collaborate button.
* *The collaborate indicator is a visual indicator on the phone that signals to the user that the party (or at least one party in a multiparty call) has the capability of collaborating with the user.* The indicator is illuminated when the parties have at least one common collaboration application program supporting at least one protocol in common. The indicator remains illuminated as long as at least one other party remains in the call with the capability to collaborate.
* *The collaborate button is a button on the phone that, when pressed, launches or brings a collaboration application to the foreground at the user's desktop.* The button takes no action unless the collaborate indicator is lit. The button is used to initiate a collaboration session, such as a video conference or document sharing.
* *The system uses a call control unit to implement various telephony applications, including call setup and tear-down.* The call control unit includes a plurality of phone proxies, each associated with a telephone registered to the system. The proxies maintain the call state for an associated telephone and include a database containing the telephone number and IP address of the phone.
* *The system can be implemented in various ways, including a peer-to-peer architecture or a client-server architecture.* The system can also be implemented using a variety of protocols, including H.323 and IP/PPP/33.6 Modem or ISDN BRI. The system can be deployed in a corporate LAN, WAN, or the Internet, or on top of dedicated telephone systems such as PBX, PSTN, or ISDN.

<summary>
* The invention relates to the insertion of clips or advertising sequences into a sequence of video pictures, with the goal of optimizing the visual impact of the advertising. The method generates a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point and a salience map for each advertising clip, and then determines a degree of similarity between the two maps.
* The degree of similarity can be determined in different ways, such as by calculating the correlation coefficient or the Kullback-Leibler divergence between the two maps, or by selecting the N most salient points in each map and calculating the average Euclidean distance between corresponding points. The method then selects the advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity and inserts it into the video sequence at the insertion point.
* The invention also relates to a device for processing pictures that implements the method, which includes a random access memory, a read-only memory, a processing unit, an input/output interface, and a man-machine interface. The device can detect shot changes in the video sequence and insert the advertising clip at the point of the shot change.
* The method can be used to insert advertising clips at points other than shot changes, such as at specific points defined in the metadata accompanying the video sequence or at regular intervals of time into the sequence.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a recessed mask structure used in semiconductor devices to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections, resulting in lower electrical breakdown. The recessed mask structure is positioned below the surface to be planarized, where the surfaces of the regions separated by the dielectric are undisturbed and have complete integrity.
• The recessed mask structure is achieved through a unique process that permits both the benefit of having a recessed surface of the mask with respect to a device surface where high electric field concentration points are present, and the benefit of having a final mask thickness that is selectable and no thicker than necessary. The process involves removing mask material between points of high electric field concentration, down to a level that is away from the surface where the high fields are located and continuing until a selected mask thickness is reached.
• The recessed mask structure provides several beneficial features, including a lower and predictable overall capacitance, which is valuable because it results in faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring. The structure also minimizes damage from planarization operations to the conductive liner at the points of high electric field concentration, and provides a lower capacitance due to the recessed mask structure.

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer is a novel design for an analog-to-digital converter that uses digital signal processing techniques to convert a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to a digital representation. The design minimizes the use of analog circuitry, reducing the complexity and cost of the converter.
* The converter uses a predictive filter to generate a prediction of the input signal at the next sampling epoch, and then subtracts this prediction from the input signal to generate a prediction error signal. This error signal is then sampled and converted to a digital representation.
* The predictive filter is implemented using digital signal processing techniques, allowing the filter response to be reprogrammed to match the input signal. This allows the filter to be adjusted dynamically to track changes in the carrier frequency or to reduce distortion caused by interfering signals.
* The predictive filter also provides word length expansion, allowing the input samples to be 1-bit quantized while the output samples are multi-bit. This increases the precision of the digital representation and reduces the implementation cost of the sampler.
* The converter uses a 1-bit sampler to convert the prediction error signal to a digital representation, which is then processed by the predictive filter. The filter output is then converted back to an analog representation using a digital-to-analog converter (DAC).
* The design provides a number of benefits, including improved dynamic range, reduced quantization noise, and increased detection bandwidth. The predictive filter can be adjusted dynamically to track changes in the carrier frequency or to reduce distortion caused by interfering signals.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating a multiplex detection array with nano-scale features for detecting analytes using a combination of nanoimprint lithography and standard photolithography. The array consists of a set of parallel semiconductor nanotraces that are patterned over the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes. The nanotraces are fabricated using nanoimprint lithography, which allows for the creation of nanodimension features without the use of expensive stepper aligner tools. The dimensions of the nanotraces are critical for increasing the response sensitivity to a level that provides practical direct electrical transduction of target molecule binding.
* The fabrication process begins with the deposition of a gate electrode layer over the substrate, followed by the deposition of a gate dielectric layer and a source electrode layer. The source electrode layer is patterned using standard photolithography, and the interdigitated finger region is created by patterning the source electrode layer. The drain electrode layer is then deposited, and a photoresist layer is spun over the entire surface and patterned to protect the set of parallel nanotraces. The drain electrode layer is then patterned, and the vias are created to connect the drain electrode stub bonding pads to the drain electrode layer.
* The invention also includes a method for patterning the base electrode structures, which involves depositing a gate electrode layer over the substrate, followed by the deposition of a gate dielectric layer and a source electrode layer. The source electrode layer is patterned using standard photolithography, and the interdigitated finger region is created by patterning the source electrode layer. The drain electrode layer is then deposited, and a photoresist layer is spun over the entire surface and patterned to protect the set of parallel nanotraces. The drain electrode layer is then patterned, and the vias are created to connect the drain electrode stub bonding pads to the drain electrode layer.
